intro: Momordica dioeca, commonly known as the bitter apple or wild cucumber, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is a climbing vine characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, green, spiny fruits that turn yellow or orange when mature. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The species is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
